intro: Corydalis govaniana var. kedarensis, commonly known as the Kedarnath Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region of India. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant features slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its flowers are primarily pollinated by insects, and it is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
